body_html: Hi, @martinwicke . I noticed that contrib supports more features than core. Say, tf.contrib.learn.estimator supports feature_enginerring_fn, while tf.estimator not. If tf.contrib.learn.estimator is deprecated, where do we find the missing features?
body_text: Hi, @martinwicke . I noticed that contrib supports more features than core. Say, tf.contrib.learn.estimator supports feature_enginerring_fn, while tf.estimator not. If tf.contrib.learn.estimator is deprecated, where do we find the missing features?
body: Hi, @martinwicke . I noticed that contrib supports more features than core. Say, `tf.contrib.learn.estimator` supports `feature_enginerring_fn`, while `tf.estimator` not. If `tf.contrib.learn.estimator` is deprecated, where do we find the missing features?
